meanings.definition: A synthetic compound with the molecular formula C8H8, consisting of eight carbon atoms arranged at the corners of a cube.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the properties of cubane in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Organic chemists use cubane to understand molecular structures.
meanings.sent3: At the chemistry party, cubane was the coolest molecule around.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a cubane of ideas, each corner representing a different thought.
meanings.sent5: The cubane model helped students visualize complex carbon arrangements.

meanings.definition: A type of hydrocarbon with a cubic structure, often used in organic chemistry.
meanings.sent1: The lab assistant handled the cubane sample with care.
meanings.sent2: Organic chemists appreciate the unique properties of cubane.
meanings.sent3: The cubane molecule threw a tiny cube-shaped party in the beaker.
meanings.sent4: In the world of molecules, cubane stood out like a cube in a sea of spheres.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a model of cubane to explain the concept of hydrocarbons.
